net.tridentsdk.api.entity

Interface Impalable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Ageable, Bat, Blaze, Chicken, Cow, Creeper, EnderDragon, Enderman, Endermite, Ghast, Guardian, Horse, Hostile, LivingEntity, MagmaCube, Mooshroom, Neutral, Ocelot, Peaceful, Pig, Player, Rabbit, Saddleable, Sheep, Skeleton, Slime, Tameable, Villager, Wither, Wolf, Zombie
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Block, TridentBat, TridentBlaze, TridentBlock, TridentChicken, TridentCow, TridentCreeper, TridentEnderDragon, TridentEnderman, TridentEndermite, TridentGhast, TridentHorse, TridentInventoryHolder, TridentLivingEntity, TridentMagmaCube, TridentMooshroom, TridentOcelot, TridentPig, TridentPlayer

    public interface Impalable
    A tile or entity that can be hit by a projectile

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Entity impaledEntity()
      Gets the entity that was impaled by the projectile
      Block impaledTile()
      Gets the block (tile) that was impaled by the projectile
      boolean isImpaledEntity()
      Whether or not the impalable is an entity
      boolean isImpaledTile()
      Whether or not the impalable is a block (tile)
      java.util.Collection<Projectile> projectiles()
      Gets the projectiles that impaled the object

    • Method Detail

      • isImpaledEntity

        boolean isImpaledEntity()
        Whether or not the impalable is an entity
        Returns:
        true if the impaled object is an entity, false if it is a tile

      • isImpaledTile

        boolean isImpaledTile()
        Whether or not the impalable is a block (tile)
        Returns:
        true if the impaled object is a block (tile), false if it is an entity

      • impaledEntity

        Entity impaledEntity()
        Gets the entity that was impaled by the projectile

        Returns null if isImpaledEntity == false

        Returns:
        the entity impaled by the projectile

      • impaledTile

        Block impaledTile()
        Gets the block (tile) that was impaled by the projectile

        Returns null if isImpaledTile == false

        Returns:
        the impaled block (tile)

      • projectiles

        java.util.Collection<Projectile> projectiles()
        Gets the projectiles that impaled the object

        The list is ordered by first is oldest available arrow, and the last projectile is the newest projectile impaling the tile/entity.

        Returns null if the current impalable was never hit by a projectile, or impaledEntity == null && impaledTile == null

        This is a thread-safe weakreference collection

        Returns:
        the last projectile that impaled the object
